page.title: 12The Common,Bayston Hill.
page.content: In the middle of the oldest part of Bayston Hill,East of the A49,is The Common.It is a big round piece of ground which everybody can play on and there are grazing rights which means you can graze sheep or any thing on it. There was a very old ram on the Common.Everyone knew him.He was big, fat,and his name was Starsky.Mr. Edwards who owned the ram used to tie Starsky to a stake on the Common so people could come and stroke him. You could see where he had eaten the grass from around him because he could hardly stand up. He wasn't very well because of all the weight he was carrying about with him.I used to go up every night and see him but one time I went up Mr. Edwards told me that Starsky had gone blind and had died of old age.
